resources.string: Association de la Jeunesse Auxerroise, commonly known as AJ Auxerre, is a French football club based in the city of Auxerre in Burgundy.The club was founded in 1905.

AJ Auxerre was founded in 1905 by Abbé Ernest Deschamps and quickly found success in the Catholic league, reaching the F.G.S.P.F. Championship final in 1908. After World War I, the club moved to what would become the Abbé Deschamps Stadium. Auxerre reached Division 1 for the first time in 1980, marked by strong performances and the arrival of prolific striker Andrzej Szarmach. 

 Throughout the 1980s, Auxerre rose in French football. They finished third in 1983–84 and entered European competition the following season. Although early exits were common, the club steadily improved, achieving strong league positions and making deeper UEFA Cup runs. They also developed notable talents and honored the memory of Michel N Gom, who tragically died in 1984. 

 In the early 1990s, Auxerre gained further European recognition, highlighted by a UEFA Cup semi-final run in 1992–93. The team secured its first major trophy by winning the French Cup, followed by an historic 1995–96 season when they claimed both Division 1 and the Coupe de France, solidifying their place among France’s top clubs. 

 Auxerre remained in Ligue 1 until 2012 before facing years of struggle in Ligue 2. A brief return to the top tier in 2022 ended in immediate relegation, but the club continued to fight back. On 11 May 2024, Auxerre secured another promotion to Ligue 1, marking their return to the top level after only one season away.
